sell.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to give something to someone in exchange for money
sell.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: If you offer him another hundred, I think he’ll sell.
He regrets selling all his old records.
Tony had to sell the business at a loss.
I won’t sell you my shares!
The vase was sold to a Dutch buyer.
sell.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to offer something for people to buy
sell.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Smoke alarms sell for as little as five pounds.
sell.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to make people want to buy something
sell.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The car’s new design will help sell it to consumers.
sell.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Tickets for the concert just aren’t selling.
Her last book sold millions of copies.
All the new houses have been sold.
sell.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: to try to make someone accept a new idea or plan, or to become accepted
sell.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: It’s all right for Washington, but will it sell in small-town America?
Joe’s completely sold on the concept.
It’s hard for any government to sell new taxes to the electorate.
managers selling employees the new working hours
sell.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: sell
to give something to someone in exchange for money
He sold his motorcycle.
The shop sells old furniture.
Do you sell books on gardening?
export
to send goods to another country to be sold
Which countries export oil to the United States?
deal in something
to buy and sell a particular type of goods as part of your business
He deals in antiques.
put something up for sale/put something on the market
to make something available to be bought
When the painting was first put up for sale, no one thought that it would be worth so much money.
The farm was put up for sale.
sell up
to sell your house or your business so that you can move to a different place or do something different
They’re thinking of selling up and moving to Canada.
auction something/sell something at auction
to sell things at a special event to the person who offers the most money
The contents of his home will be auctioned.
flog
to sell something, especially something that is of low quality
A man at the market was flogging £10 watches.
peddle
to sell cheap things in the street. Also used about selling illegal drugs and pornography
Street vendors peddled American and British cigarettes.
People who peddle drugs to children should be severely punished.
traffic in something
to buy and sell large quantities of illegal goods or people
They trafficked in illegal weapons.
The gang were involved in people-trafficking.
drug-trafficking
sell.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to give someone property, assets, goods, services etc in return for money
sell.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Chrysler plans to raise cash byselling assets.
Investors are selling more aggressively ahead of quarterly earnings reports.
Canada’s largest oil and gas concern will be sold to the public through a series of share issues.
He was forced to sell the magazine for $29.1 million.
sell.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: to make something available for people to buy
sell.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: In most countries, the firm sells its hi-fi equipment under the name Kenwood.
sell.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: to be offered for sale at a particular price
sell.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: High-priced desktop computers sell for $20,000 and up.
sell.translation[2].definitions[3].defin: to encourage people to buy something
sell.translation[2].definitions[3].examp: Reebok hopes their new promotion will sell the sportswear range.
sell.translation[2].definitions[4].defin: to be bought in large quantities
sell.translation[2].definitions[4].examp: Corporate bonds issued this year have sold fast.
Many companies are developing packaging that both protects the environment and sells.
sell.translation[2].definitions[5].defin: to impress people with your abilities and good qualities
sell.translation[2].definitions[5].examp: He believes in his company, and he sells himself, marketing his own beliefs.
sell.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: a product, idea, service etc that you sell or try to sell
sell.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: Despite spending more than £10 million on ads, the product was atough sell (=difficult to sell).
There was a lack of confidence that the computer would be an easy sell (=easy to sell).
sell.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: when a salesperson uses a lot of pressure to make a customer buy something
sell.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: A successful salesperson has to be good at the hard sell.
sell.translation[3].definitions[2].defin: when someone tries to encourage and persuade a customer to buy something, rather than using a lot of pressure
sell.translation[3].definitions[2].examp: The soft sell works in four out of five cases.
